messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: moving to Germany
messages.msgSnippet: ... Also - NHEN has a whole section of the website designed specifically for military homeschooling families and includes a database of contacts. -pam National
messages.messageBody:
On Jan 15, 2004, at 1:59 AM, Stefanie Mohsennia wrote:

> Hopefully
> there will be a homeschooling community of some sorts at your base.

Also - NHEN has a whole section of the website designed specifically
for military homeschooling families and includes a database of
contacts.

-pam
National Home Education Network
<www.NHEN.org>
Serving the entire homeschooling community since 1999
through information, networking and public relations.

messages.subject: Re: moving to Germany
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Wendy, this is Stefanie from Germany. We are near Cologne and would be happy to meet you. When are you leaving and where will you be stationed? I know
messages.messageBody:
Hi Wendy,

this is Stefanie from Germany. We are near Cologne and would be happy to
meet you. When are you leaving and where will you be stationed? I know
Brenda who is stationed near Frankfurt. Her 7yo is now in school, one of
the reasons (I think) being that they found it difficult to homeschool
with practically no other children around during the day. Hopefully
there will be a homeschooling community of some sorts at your base. As
others have mentioned, homeschooling is illegal in Germany, but these
laws won't apply for you. It just means, there won't be any German
homeschoolers to get together with. I would be happy to hear from you!

All the best from Germany,
Stefanie
www.unschooling.de

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] moving to Germany
messages.msgSnippet: Is Brenda still here? I forget exactly where they were stationed. She d probably be a good contact when you got there. Barb E Listen to your life. See it for
messages.messageBody:
Is Brenda still here? I forget exactly where they were stationed. She'd
probably be a good contact when you got there.


Barb E
"Listen to your life. See it for the fathomless mystery that it
is. In the boredom and pain of it no less than in the
excitement and gladness: touch, taste, smell your way to
the holy and hidden heart of it because in the last
analysis all moments are key moments, and life itself is
grace."

- Frederick Buechner, Author, in "Now and Then"
